mbostock@gmail.com.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/zenmoto/d3 into stage-2.9.0
Merge branch 'xhr_header' of https://github.com/kitmonisit/d3 into stage-2.9.0
Merge branch 'brush-ie9' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into stage-2.9.0
Fix #434: chord groups returned in wrong order.
Merge branch 'area-closed' of https://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into line-defined

Better implementation of defined.

The previous implementation had a bug where the original index (i) was not
preserved if the input data array were split. The new implementation eschews the
previous approach of branching based on whether the x- and y-properties are
defined as functions or constants, opting for the simpler functor approach. The
x- and y-values are also coerced to numbers, as appropriate.

Merge pull request #526 from mjijackson/readme

Add note about running the tests

Fix a bug when interpolating exponent notation.

We weren't properly detecting "1.e2" as a valid number.

Merge pull request #585 from cscheid/master

fix typo on path

Include brush mode with event.

This allows listeners to distinguish between move and resize events.

michael@thousandeyes.com.message: Capture click events in zoom behavior to ensure they're cancelled.
Initial drag mousedown event needs to be cancelled, too.

david@balrog.org.message: Fixed version specification for new sizzle dependency.
Add sizzle selector dependency to node module build.

jon.seymour@gmail.com.message:
Add a test that a degenerate domain does not cause histogram to barf.

Signed-off-by: Jon Seymour <jon.seymour@gmail.com>

jason@jasondavies.com.message:
d3.xhr: treat req.status === 0 as error.

This occurs during a failed cross-origin request, for example.

Use display: none for IE9 workaround.

Saves a line, too!

Add another note about the workaround.

For consistency.

Better workaround for IE9 bug.

I was mistaken in the previous commit (probably forgot to run make!)

An even better workaround for an IE9 bug.

It's as if IE9 is forgetting about the visibility: hidden rect, and
doing *something* to it jogs its memory.

Reinstate pointer-events: all on parent <g>.

This is required for the invisible resize handles.  Also added comment
about IE9 workaround.

Fix background rect brush events for IE9.

I'm not sure pointer-events: all is necessary on the parent <g>, so I've
removed it assuming it's sufficient on the background <rect>.

Slightly shorter.

This is also more future-compatible with *-closed interpolators!
Add simple tests for closed radial areas.

Use a subpath for closed area interpolation.

This is more relevant for radial areas e.g. when using both stroke and
fill simultaneously on the same paths in a stacked radial area.

kmonisit@gmail.com.message: Set X-Requested-With header for all cases
Add X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest header to xhr
